meanings.definition: Adulterine: relating to or characterized by adultery
meanings.sent1: The adulterine affair caused a lot of gossip in the small town.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty about her adulterine actions.
meanings.sent3: The soap opera had an adulterine plot twist that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like an adulterine web, tangled and deceitful.
meanings.sent5: The adulterine love triangle ended in heartbreak and betrayal.

meanings.definition: Adulterine: not genuine or legitimate; illegitimate
meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper was caught selling adulterine goods.
meanings.sent2: He refused to accept the adulterine document as proof.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit painting was an adulterine masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed adulterine, hiding true feelings beneath.
meanings.sent5: The adulterine ring turned out to be a fake, much to her disappointment.

meanings.definition: Adulterine: a product resulting from adulteration or impurity
meanings.sent1: The food inspector found an adulterine substance in the milk.
meanings.sent2: Consumers should be cautious of adulterine products on the market.
meanings.sent3: The potion had an adulterine ingredient that made people sneeze glitter.
meanings.sent4: The river was polluted with an adulterine discharge from the factory.
meanings.sent5: The medicine was recalled due to an adulterine component that caused side effects.
